snippet: Rula Ghani will advocate for women and children, taking on far more prominence than her predecessor, Zeenat Karzai, who was rarely seen in public.
abstract: Rula Ghani, wife of Afghan Pres Ashraf Ghani, will play a far more public role than her predecessor Zeenat Karzai, who was rarely seen in the open; Ashraf Ghani indicates shift by praising his wife at inauguration ceremony, saying she will have a role in advocating for women, children and the internally displaced.

byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH and ROD NORDLAND
byline.contributor: Mohammad Ghannam contributed reporting from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: Rula Ghani will advocate for women and children, taking on far more prominence than her predecessor, Zeenat Karzai, who was rarely seen in public.

headline.main: Jolting Some, Afghan Leader Brings Wife Into the Picture
headline.print_headline: Jolting Some, Afghan Leader Brings Wife Into the Picture
